member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpConnection
member.summary: Implements the AMQP 1.0 connection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpConnectionBase
member.summary: The base class for AMQP connection. It should be version independent.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpConstants
member.summary: Constants for the protocol stack. Extended constants should be defined in ClientConstants.cs

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpDebug
member.summary: This class logs the frame activity on session and dumps them into a file for debugging issues that are difficult to repro under debugger. The output file is named as "session#.log" and it contains lines as follows: ticks(10000) direction op p1 p2 1653194746831 9 RECV 17 0 0 1653194746844 9 SEND 17 0 0 Refer to the calls to AmqpDebug.Log for parameter definition. Enable this logging by including AMQP_DEBUG constant in the project file for the desired build configuration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpLink
member.summary: Implements the transport-layer link, including link command handling and link flow control.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpMessage
member.summary: Implements the AMQP MESSAGE FORMAT 0 message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpMessage.AmqpBodyStreamMessage
member.summary: Wraps a stream in the message body. The data is sent in one or more Data sections.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpMessage.AmqpOutputStreamMessage
member.summary: The stream contains an entire AMQP message. When the stream is sent out, the mutable sections are updated.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpMessage.AmqpInputStreamMessage
member.summary: Used on the receiver side. The entire message is immutable (changes are discarded).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpObject.Abort
member.summary: Move to End state without closing

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpObject.SafeClose
member.summary: Close with exception handling

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpSettings.TransportProviders
member.summary: Providers should be added in preferred order.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AsyncIO.AsyncReader
member.summary: A reader that pumps frames from the transport and hands it over to the handler

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AsyncIO.AsyncBufferReader
member.summary: A reader that reads specified bytes and notifies caller upon completion (pull).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AsyncIO.FrameBufferReader
member.summary: A reader that reads AMQP frame buffers. Not thread safe.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AsyncIO.AsyncWriter
member.summary: A writer that writes buffers. Buffer writes may be batched. Writer owns closing the transport.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AsyncIO.AsyncFrameWriter
member.summary: A writer that writes complete AMQP frames. Frame writes may be batched. Writer owns closing the transport.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AsyncIO.AsyncBufferWriter
member.summary: A writer that writes fixed-size buffer and notify caller upon completion.

member.summary: This API supports the Azure infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Framing.AmqpDescribed
member.summary: Descriptor is restricted to symbol and ulong

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Framing.DescribedList
member.summary: Encoding of DescribedType(symbol/ulong, list) is not efficient if the descriptor and the list fields are pre-defined, e.g. the performatives and other types used by the protocol.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Framing.Multiple`1
member.summary: Multiple is not an AMQP data type. It is a property of a list field that affects the encoding of the associated data type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.HandleTable`1
member.summary: Designed for session channel and link handle lookup. Not for general purpose uses.

member.summary: ICbsTokenProvider interface

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.ICbsTokenProvider.GetTokenAsync(System.Uri,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Generate a Token for use with CBS.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.ReceivingAmqpLink.SizeBasedFlowQueue
member.summary: The different this class from the normal Queue is that if we specify a size then we will perform Amqp Flow based on the size, where: - When en-queuing we will keep sending credit flow as long as size is not over the limit. - When de-queuing we will issue flow as soon as the size is below the threshold. - When issuing credit we always issue in increment of boundedTotalLinkCredit - boundedTotalLinkCredit is based on [total cache size] / [max message size]

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Transport.AmqpTransportInitiator.#ctor(Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpSettings,Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Transport.TransportSettings)
member.summary: This initiator establishes a base transport using the transport settings Then it iterates through the security provider list in the settings to upgrade the transport (e.g. tcp -> tls -> sasl).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Transport.AmqpTransportListener
member.summary: This listener supports protocol upgrade (e.g. tcp -> tls -> sasl)

member.summary: This initiator establishes an SSL connection (no AMQP security upgrade)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Transport.TlsTransportListener
member.summary: This listener accepts SSL transport directly (no AMQP security upgrade)

member.summary: ExceptionPolicy.Transfer is used if you want the async result to be completed with the exception when the step throws.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.IteratorAsyncResult`1.ExceptionPolicy.Continue
member.summary: ExceptionPolicy.Continue is used if you want to ignore the exception and continue next steps. The last exception ignored can be accessed with LastAsyncException property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.ResourcesGeneric.TimeoutMustBePositive

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Singleton`1
member.summary: This API supports the Azure infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Singleton`1.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and optionally releases managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.TaskHelpers.CreateTask(System.Func{System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.IAsyncResult},System.Action{System.IAsyncResult},System.Object)
member.summary: Create a Task based on Begin/End IAsyncResult pattern.
member.param: This parameter helps reduce allocations by passing state to the Funcs. e.g.: await TaskHelpers.CreateTask( (c, s) => ((Transaction)s).BeginCommit(c, s), (a) => ((Transaction)a.AsyncState).EndCommit(a), transaction);

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.EventTraceActivity
member.summary: This class holds the ActivityId that would be set on the thread for ETW during the trace.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.TrackingContext
member.summary: TrackingContext class is used to communicate tracking information for each request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.TrackingContext.TrackingId
member.summary: Returns the tracking id used in this context

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.TrackingContext.SystemTracker
member.summary: Returns the system tracker used in this context

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.TrackingContext.GetInstanceFromKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return a tracking context for a key that is common for a subsystem. It generates a new Guid if the key is not present in the collection.
member.param: key to lookup an existing Guid for TrackingId
subsystem-specific string like entityName to be used in the tracking context

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.TrackingContext.GetInstance(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Return a tracking context for the given trackingId.
member.param: TrackingId to use for the tracking context
subsystem-specific string like entityName to be used in the tracking context

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.TrackingContext.GetInstance(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return a tracking context for the given trackingId.
member.param: TrackingId to use for the tracking context
subsystem-specific string like entityName to be used in the tracking context
Generally false. Set to true only when the message is received at role boundaries

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.TrackingContext.SetTrackingContextRoleIdentifier(System.String,Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.Tracing.TrackingContext.RolePrefix)
member.summary: Sets the role identifier for the process' app domain. The role identifier field is singleton. It is called externally outside TrackingContext to avoid dependancy on Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ServiceRuntime
